docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 A SenateHouse conference committee voted today to outlaw in most instances abortions performed under the Federal Medicaid program, but the committee specified certain cases in which such abortions would be permissible.

headline.main: CONFEREES VOTE BAN ON MEDICAID FUNDS FOR MOST ABORTIONS; Certain Exceptions Are Specified in Compromise House Relaxes Standards on Auto Pollution Senate-House Parley Votes Ban On Medicaid for Most Abortions

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 A SenateHouse conference committee voted today to outlaw in most instances abortions performed under the Federal Medicaid program, but the committee specified certain cases in which such abortions would be permissible.

byline.original: By DAVID E. ROSENBAUM Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Adm bill to allot $3.5-billion in loan guarantees and $500-million in price supports to aid cos testing synthetic fuels released by HR Rules Com; passage doubted since both liberal and conservative groups are opposed (S)
